dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.scanToStart: Scan a directory to find projects
dashboard.githubExpiredDesc: Reconnect your GitHub account to see your repositories
dashboard.githubLoadErrorDesc: Could not load your GitHub repositories
dashboard.quote1: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
dashboard.quote2: Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works.
dashboard.quote3: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
dashboard.quote4: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
dashboard.quote5: The only way to go fast is to go well.
dashboard.quote6: The most dangerous phrase in the language is: We've always done it this way.
dashboard.quote7: If you double the number of experiments you do per year, you're going to double your inventiveness.
dashboard.quote8: Our industry does not respect tradition — it only respects innovation.
dashboard.quote9: If you are not embarrassed by the first version of your product, you've launched too late.
dashboard.quote11: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
dashboard.quote12: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.errorNoTechLead: No Tech Lead agent available. Configure a Tech Lead agent before starting workflows.

agents.title: Agents
agents.deleteConfirm: Delete agent "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone.
agents.selectOrCreate: Select an agent from the list or create a new one

settings.title: Settings
settings.profileDesc: Customize your name, avatar, and identification color
settings.name: Name
settings.workspaceDesc: Default directory to automatically scan for projects
settings.initializingRepoDesc: This may take a few seconds. Cloning and configuring the repository.
settings.aiProvidersDesc: Manage your AI provider connections for agent execution

openai.title: OpenAI API
openai.desc: Connect your OpenAI API Key to use GPT and Codex models with agents
openai.envSource: API key configured via environment variable
openai.howToGet: How to get your API Key

providers.codexInstructions: Or install Codex CLI and run 'codex login'
providers.claudeInstructions: Install Claude Code CLI and run 'claude'

auth.termsPrefix: By signing in, you agree to our

landing.hero: Your AI agent team. In a single platform.
landing.heroSub: Full dashboard to orchestrate autonomous agents that develop, test, and review code — managed via web, WhatsApp, or CLI.
landing.featuresTitle: Everything you need to orchestrate AI agents
landing.featuresSubtitle: A visual platform to manage the entire development cycle with intelligent agents
landing.featureAgentsDesc: Architect, Backend Dev, Frontend Dev, QA Tester, Code Reviewer, DevOps, and Doc Writer — each with customizable system prompts, AI models, and skills
landing.featureWhatsappDesc: Receive notifications, create tasks, and track agent progress directly from WhatsApp or Telegram — no browser needed
landing.featureGitDesc: Commits, branches, pull requests, and code review — all managed by agents directly on GitHub
landing.featureMultiModelDesc: Choose the ideal model for each agent — Claude Sonnet, Opus, Haiku, or GPT via Codex. Switch anytime without reconfiguring
landing.featureReviewDesc: QA agent reviews every change with detailed feedback, improvement suggestions, and automatic approval when code is ready
landing.featureRealtimeDesc: Watch every agent action live — logs, tool calls, modified files, and task progress in real-time via WebSocket
landing.featureAnalyticsDesc: Dashboard with performance metrics, tokens consumed, cost per task, and productivity per agent
landing.featureEditorDesc: Built-in Monaco Editor with syntax highlighting, diff view, and full project navigation without leaving the platform
landing.ctaTitle: Ready for your AI agent team?
landing.ctaSubtitle: Open the platform, import your GitHub project, and see your agents working in minutes
landing.agentsTitle: A complete AI team at your command
landing.agentsSubtitle: Each agent has a specialized role, with persistent memory and configurable skills
landing.agentArchitectDesc: Analyzes requirements and creates implementation plans
landing.agentBackendDesc: Implements APIs, services, and business logic
landing.howItWorksSubtitle: Three steps to automate your development workflow
landing.step1Desc: Connect directly from GitHub with one click or scan a local directory from your workspace
landing.step2Desc: Choose roles, AI models, skills, and define custom workflows for each agent
landing.step3Desc: Your agents work together in real-time — from commits to code reviews, all from the dashboard or WhatsApp
landing.cliNote: Also available via CLI for terminal lovers

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.noData: No data for the selected period

whatsapp.title: WhatsApp
whatsapp.desc: Connect WhatsApp to manage tasks and communicate with agents

apiDocs.searchPlaceholder: Search endpoints by path or description...
apiDocs.emptyDesc: Generate your API documentation to see all available endpoints.

skills.title: Skills
skills.name: Name
skills.instructionsHint: Instructions that will be injected into the agent's system prompt when this skill is assigned
skills.emptyDesc: Create your first skill to enhance your agents with specialized capabilities
skills.noSkillsAvailable: No skills available. Create skills in Settings to assign them here.
skills.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this skill?

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.purpose: Overview of your workspace with projects, active agents, recent activity, and real-time task metrics.
dashboard.feature_0: Scan directories or import from GitHub
dashboard.tip_0: Use the workspace scanner to find projects automatically
dashboard.tip_1: Click any project to access the full dashboard

agents.title: Agents
agents.purpose: Manage your AI agent team — configure models, permissions, skills, and system prompts for each agent.
agents.feature_0: Create and configure agents with different roles
agents.feature_1: Choose AI model (Claude, GPT) per agent
agents.feature_2: Set level, permissions, and allowed tools
agents.feature_3: Assign specialized skills to each agent
agents.tip_0: Use different roles to simulate a real dev team
agents.tip_1: Senior agents have more detailed system prompts

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.purpose: Global task list across your workspace with filters, status tracking, and agent assignment.
tasks.feature_0: Create tasks with title, description, and priority
tasks.feature_1: Filter by status, priority, or agent
tasks.tip_0: Tasks in 'Review' are waiting for your approval
tasks.tip_1: Use the side drawer to view details without leaving the list

docs.title: Documentation
docs.purpose: Access project documentation and auto-generated API reference with all available endpoints.
docs.feature_2: Search endpoints by path or description
docs.tip_0: Regenerate API Docs after adding new endpoints
docs.tip_1: Use the sidebar table of contents for quick navigation

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.purpose: Metrics dashboard with task overview, success rate, average time, and per-agent performance breakdown.
analytics.feature_0: Task charts by period (7d, 30d, all time)
analytics.feature_1: Success rate and average execution time
analytics.tip_0: Switch between periods to identify trends
analytics.tip_1: The 'By Agent' tab shows who is most productive

settings.title: Settings
settings.purpose: Customize your profile, appearance, language, default workspace, and AI provider connections.
settings.feature_0: Profile with name, avatar, and color
settings.feature_2: Connect Claude and OpenAI as providers
settings.tip_0: Connect at least one AI provider to run agents
settings.tip_1: System theme adapts to your OS preference

projectOverview.title: Project Overview
projectOverview.purpose: Project summary with task stats, active agents, configured team, and recent tasks.
projectOverview.feature_0: Cards with task counters and progress
projectOverview.feature_1: List of active agents in the project
projectOverview.feature_3: Quick access to board, tasks, and files
projectOverview.tip_0: Use the side chat to interact with agents in project context
projectOverview.tip_1: The overview updates in real-time via WebSocket

projectBoard.title: Board
projectBoard.purpose: Visual Kanban with status columns to organize and move tasks between Backlog, In Progress, Review, and Done.
projectBoard.feature_1: Create tasks directly on the board
projectBoard.feature_2: Assign agents to tasks from the board
projectBoard.feature_3: Quick view of priority and assigned agent
projectBoard.tip_0: Drag tasks to 'Review' when you want a review
projectBoard.tip_1: Cards show agent, priority, and branch

projectTasks.title: Project Tasks
projectTasks.purpose: Detailed task list for the project with advanced filters, detail drawer, and quick actions.
projectTasks.feature_0: Filter tasks by status or assigned agent
projectTasks.feature_1: Side drawer with full task details
projectTasks.feature_3: View code changes and task results
projectTasks.tip_0: Click a task to open the detail drawer
projectTasks.tip_1: Use 'View Changes' to review the code diff

projectAgents.title: Project Agents
projectAgents.purpose: Configure the project-specific agent team — assign agents, workflows, and custom configurations.
projectAgents.feature_0: Assign agents to the project with specific configs
projectAgents.tip_0: Each project can have a different agent team
projectAgents.tip_1: Workflows define the agent execution order

projectFiles.title: Files
projectFiles.purpose: Browse the project file tree with the integrated Monaco editor — view and edit code without leaving the platform.
projectFiles.tip_0: Use Ctrl+S to save changes in the editor

projectPrs.title: Pull Requests
projectPrs.purpose: View and manage pull requests created by agents — check status, diffs, and available actions.
projectPrs.feature_0: PR list with status and summary
projectPrs.feature_1: View change diffs for each PR
projectPrs.feature_2: Quick actions: merge, close, or comment
projectPrs.tip_0: Agents create PRs automatically after completing tasks
projectPrs.tip_1: Review the diff before approving a PR

projectPreview.title: Preview
projectPreview.purpose: View the running project directly in the platform — integrated preview for web projects.
projectPreview.feature_2: Open in new tab for full screen
projectPreview.tip_0: Preview works best with web projects (React, Vue, etc.)
projectPreview.tip_1: Use reload after agents make changes

projectSettings.title: Project Settings
projectSettings.purpose: Configure integrations (Git, WhatsApp, Telegram), project path, description, and specific preferences.
projectSettings.feature_2: Connect Telegram as an alternative channel
projectSettings.feature_3: Edit project name, description, and path
projectSettings.tip_0: Connect Git to enable automatic commits and PRs
projectSettings.tip_1: WhatsApp lets you create tasks via message

workflow.noStepsDesc: Start by adding the first step to the workflow.
workflow.noNextSteps: None — select the node and click + below

validation.title: Issues found
validation.noSteps: Empty workflow — add at least one step

simulation.active: Simulation active — numbers show execution order

pixelOffice.label: Office
pixelOffice.title: PIXEL OFFICE
pixelOffice.subtitle: Visualize your tasks as a virtual office
